bug.author: cyrilthank
bug.summary: kfctl apply all -V errors with Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize
bug.description:
What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] kfctl apply all -V errors with INFO[0009] creating Service/zipkin filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:447" Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" What did you expect to happen: kubeflow to complete installation and configuration of all the remaining pods Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard):
kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7
Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) kubernetes
Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): kubeflow@masternode:/nfsroot/kf-poc$ kubectl version Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16", GitVersion:"v1.16.0", GitCommit:"2bd9643cee5b3b3a5ecbd3af49d09018f0773c77", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-09-18T14:36:53Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16", GitVersion:"v1.16.0", GitCommit:"2bd9643cee5b3b3a5ecbd3af49d09018f0773c77", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-09-18T14:27:17Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS kubeflow@masternode:/nfsroot/kf-poc$ kubectl get pods --all-namespaces NAMESPACE NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE kube-system coredns-5644d7b6d9-s8zk8 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system coredns-5644d7b6d9-x7wf9 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system etcd-masternode.com 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system kube-apiserver-masternode.com 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system kube-controller-manager-masternode.com 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system kube-flannel-ds-amd64-8584j 1/1 Running 3 20h kube-system kube-flannel-ds-amd64-zmxvm 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system kube-proxy-msrjp 1/1 Running 3 20h kube-system kube-proxy-s7ql9 1/1 Running 2 20h kube-system kube-scheduler-masternode.com 1/1 Running 2 20h

comments.comment: Issue Label Bot is not confident enough to auto-label this issue. See <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> for more details.
Please help as this is now a show stopper for us

Running into exactly the same issue while trying this official manual: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link>
Steps to reproduce on clean Ubuntu 16 AWS instance: <denchmark-code>#installing Kubernes cluster sudo snap install microk8s --classic sudo usermod -a -G microk8s $USER microk8s.enable dashboard dns storage #without this one `kfctl apply` will fail earlier trying to write to /.kube folder. sudo microk8s.kubectl config view --raw > $HOME/.kube/config sudo chown $USER:$USER -R ~/.kube </denchmark-code>
#installing kubeflow: <denchmark-code>opsys=linux # darwin for Mac curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/latest |\ grep browser_download |\ grep $opsys |\ cut -d '"' -f 4 |\ xargs curl -O -L && \ tar -zvxf kfctl_*_${opsys}.tar.gz </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code># Add kfctl to PATH, to make the kfctl binary easier to use. export PATH=$PATH:"/home/$USER" export KFAPP="mykfapp" # Installs Istio by default. Comment out Istio components in the config file to skip Istio #installation. See https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3663 export CONFIG="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml" kfctl init ${KFAPP} --config=${CONFIG} -V cd ${KFAPP} kfctl generate all -V kfctl apply all -V </denchmark-code>
Errouts with same message: Error: couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create resources from istio-install Error: no matches for kind "Deployment" in version "extensions/v1beta1" UPDATE: The problem is described here: <denchmark-link:https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/>https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/</denchmark-link>
Apparently config file with extensions/v1beta1 for is not suppose to work anymore. Although it works in Kubernetes 1.14.

UPDATE: The problem is described here: https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/ Apparently config file with extensions/v1beta1 for Deployment is not suppose to work anymore. Although it works in Kubernetes 1.14.
A quick workaround if you are using <denchmark-link:http://multipass.run/>multipass</denchmark-link> with <denchmark-link:http://microk8s.io/>microk8s</denchmark-link> is to install v1.14. I just tried it and it worked fine. Follow the steps in <denchmark-link:https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow>https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow</denchmark-link> but install microk8s via instead.

Can you please share if this work around works for Kubernetes ( ie the non micro/mini) as well On Thursday, October 3, 2019, 11:09:20 PM GMT+5:30, Mostafa Gazar <notifications@github.com> wrote:
UPDATE: The problem is described here: <denchmark-link:https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/>https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/09/18/kubernetes-1-16-release-announcement/</denchmark-link>
Apparently config file with extensions/v1beta1 for Deployment is not suppose to work anymore. Although it works in Kubernetes 1.14.
A quick workaround if you are using multipass with microk8s is to install v1.14. I just tried it and it worked fine.
Follow the steps in <denchmark-link:https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow>https://tutorials.ubuntu.com/tutorial/get-started-kubeflow</denchmark-link> but install microk8s via sudo snap install microk8s --classic --channel=1.14/stable instead.
â€” You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

Kubeflow doesn't support Kubernetes 1.16 yet. We are tracking it in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/issues/375>kubeflow/manifests#375</denchmark-link>
Duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/issues/375>kubeflow/manifests#375</denchmark-link>
